Loss from Variable Dropout
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Loss from Variable Dropout

Loss from Variable Dropout

variable_importance(explainer, loss_function = function(observed, predicted)
  sum((observed - predicted)^2), ..., type = "raw", n_sample = 1000)

Arguments

explainer

a model to be explained, preprocessed by the 'explain' function
loss_function

a function thet will be used to assess variable importance
...

other parameters
type

character, type of transformation that should be applied for dropout loss. 'raw' results raw drop lossess, 'ratio' returns drop_loss/drop_loss_full_model while 'difference' returns drop_loss - drop_loss_full_model
n_sample

number of observations that should be sampled for calculation of variable importance. If negative then variable importance will be calculated on whole dataset (no sampling).

Value

An object of the class 'variable_leverage_explainer'. It's a data frame with calculated average response.

Examples

 
library("breakDown")
library("randomForest")
HR_rf_model <- randomForest(left~., data = breakDown::HR_data, ntree = 100)
#> Warning: The response has five or fewer unique values.  Are you sure you want to do regression?
explainer_rf  <- explain(HR_rf_model, data = HR_data, y = HR_data$left)
vd_rf <- variable_importance(explainer_rf, type = "raw")
vd_rf
#>                 variable dropout_loss        label
#> 1           _full_model_     3.419678 randomForest
#> 2                   left     3.419678 randomForest
#> 3  promotion_last_5years     3.446718 randomForest
#> 4          Work_accident     4.062012 randomForest
#> 5                 salary     6.800405 randomForest
#> 6                  sales    10.385439 randomForest
#> 7     time_spend_company    64.150013 randomForest
#> 8   average_montly_hours    83.514239 randomForest
#> 9         number_project    88.286393 randomForest
#> 10       last_evaluation    90.226694 randomForest
#> 11    satisfaction_level   152.157162 randomForest
#> 12            _baseline_   302.482800 randomForest

HR_glm_model <- glm(left~., data = breakDown::HR_data, family = "binomial")
explainer_glm <- explain(HR_glm_model, data = HR_data, y = HR_data$left)
logit <- function(x) exp(x)/(1+exp(x))
vd_glm <- variable_importance(explainer_glm, type = "raw",
                        loss_function = function(observed, predicted)
                                     sum((observed - logit(predicted))^2))
vd_glm
#>                 variable dropout_loss label
#> 1           _full_model_     137.8479    lm
#> 2        last_evaluation     137.7812    lm
#> 3                   left     137.8479    lm
#> 4   average_montly_hours     138.0288    lm
#> 5  promotion_last_5years     138.4511    lm
#> 6                  sales     139.3857    lm
#> 7     time_spend_company     142.5970    lm
#> 8          Work_accident     151.0122    lm
#> 9         number_project     151.3822    lm
#> 10                salary     151.4485    lm
#> 11    satisfaction_level     190.3645    lm
#> 12            _baseline_     221.7890    lm

library("xgboost")
model_martix_train <- model.matrix(left~.-1, breakDown::HR_data)
data_train <- xgb.DMatrix(model_martix_train, label = breakDown::HR_data$left)
param <- list(max_depth = 2, eta = 1, silent = 1, nthread = 2,
              objective = "binary:logistic", eval_metric = "auc")
HR_xgb_model <- xgb.train(param, data_train, nrounds = 50)
explainer_xgb <- explain(HR_xgb_model, data = model_martix_train,
                     y = HR_data$left, label = "xgboost")
vd_xgb <- variable_importance(explainer_xgb, type = "raw")
vd_xgb
#>                 variable dropout_loss   label
#> 1           _full_model_     17.94626 xgboost
#> 2       salesproduct_mng     17.86196 xgboost
#> 3        salesaccounting     17.94626 xgboost
#> 4                salesIT     17.94626 xgboost
#> 5        salesmanagement     17.94626 xgboost
#> 6         salesmarketing     17.94626 xgboost
#> 7                saleshr     17.98537 xgboost
#> 8  promotion_last_5years     18.00455 xgboost
#> 9             salesRandD     18.02100 xgboost
#> 10            salessales     18.04727 xgboost
#> 11          salessupport     18.21413 xgboost
#> 12          salarymedium     18.26874 xgboost
#> 13        salestechnical     18.46045 xgboost
#> 14         Work_accident     19.22085 xgboost
#> 15             salarylow     19.59448 xgboost
#> 16  average_montly_hours     41.58146 xgboost
#> 17        number_project     45.05648 xgboost
#> 18       last_evaluation     48.18338 xgboost
#> 19    time_spend_company     66.14615 xgboost
#> 20    satisfaction_level    160.47769 xgboost
#> 21            _baseline_    333.81502 xgboost
plot(vd_xgb)
